narrative.title: 4Th Indian Division - 1940Q3
narrative.situation: British infantry_division deployed in North Africa during 1940Q3.
narrative.objectives: Infantry division preparing for offensive operations in Western Desert. Combat-ready by end of October 1940. Reinforced with attached British 16th Infantry Brigade from 9 September 1940.
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.terrain: Desert and coastal plain (Egypt-Libya border region)

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Fully trained and equipped for desert warfare by October 1940
Experienced divisional artillery commander now leading division
Mixed British and Indian battalions at brigade level
Reinforced with additional British infantry brigade

environment.terrain_type: Desert and coastal plain (Egypt-Libya border region)
